categories.name: Value Proposition
categories.description: This category focuses on testing whether the core value HomeTruth offers resonates with users and solves their problems effectively. Does the platform truly simplify home management, provide value through automation, or centralize documents in a way that is meaningful to users?

categories.name: Customer Acquisition
categories.description: How well does HomeTruth attract new users? Hypotheses here will explore the effectiveness of marketing strategies, free trials, referral programs, and customer journeys from awareness to sign-up. Are the acquisition strategies (e.g., targeting homeowners, landlords, or investors) working?

categories.name: Revenue Model
categories.description: Testing revenue streams is critical to ensure HomeTruth can generate sustainable income. Hypotheses here will explore pricing, willingness to pay for subscriptions, or the potential for affiliate partnerships. Will users pay for the service? Is the subscription model viable for different customer segments?

categories.name: Customer Retention and Engagement
categories.description: This category will test the stickiness of the platform. Does HomeTruth retain users over time, and are they engaging with the platform in a meaningful way? Do homeowners and landlords regularly use the platform, or is it just a one-time setup?

categories.name: Feature Prioritization
categories.description: Different features (document management, contractor integration, valuation tracking, blockchain/AI) may have varying levels of importance for different user segments. Hypotheses in this category will test which features are most valuable and drive engagement. Are features like Smart Home integration or maintenance reminders critical to user satisfaction?

categories.name: Market Fit
categories.description: Testing market adoption across different segments (e.g., first-time buyers, existing homeowners, landlords, investors) will help assess the product-market fit. Do the specific features and tools HomeTruth offers match the needs of each customer segment?

categories.name: Technology Integration
categories.description: This category will test the viability and desirability of integrating advanced technologies like blockchain and AI into HomeTruth. Are users interested in having blockchain-based property records, and does AI-driven property management add value?

categories.name: Partnerships
categories.description: Testing the platform’s scalability through partnerships with home service providers (Checkatrade, Zoopla, etc.), energy providers, or financial institutions. Can partnerships drive customer acquisition, create affiliate revenue, or offer additional value to users?

categories.name: Regulatory Compliance
categories.description: Test whether HomeTruth can effectively manage compliance with data protection laws, real estate regulations, and landlord requirements. Can the platform seamlessly handle regulatory changes and compliance management for landlords?

categories.name: Scalability
categories.description: This will explore whether the platform can scale in terms of technology, users, and markets without significant friction. Can the platform handle a growing number of users, properties, and integrations?
